intro: Chrysocephalum brevicilium, commonly known as the small-leaved golden crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and silver-green foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is found in regions such as New South Wales and Queensland. Its compact growth habit and ornamental appearance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. The species is also valued for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
